cards.name: Angel of Vitality
cards.text:
Flying
If you would gain life, you gain that much life plus 1 instead.
Angel of Vitality gets +2/+2 as long as you have 25 or more life.

rulings.text: If you control two Angels of Vitality and you would gain life, you gain that much life plus 2. A third Angel of Vitality has you gain that much life plus 3, and so on.

The middle ability of Angel of Vitality applies just once to each life-gaining event, whether it’s 1 life from Impassioned Orator or 4 life from Dawning Angel. If you gain an amount of life “for each” of something or “equal to the number” of something, that life is gained as one event and the ability of Angel of Vitality applies only once.

Each creature with lifelink dealing combat damage causes a separate life-gaining event. For example, if two creatures you control with lifelink deal combat damage at the same time, Angel of Vitality’s second ability will apply twice. However, if a single creature you control with lifelink deals combat damage to multiple creatures, players, and/or planeswalkers at the same time (perhaps because it has trample or was blocked by more than one creature), the ability will apply only once.

If Angel of Vitality is dealt damage and your life total is increased above 25 before state-based actions are performed (most likely because Angel of Vitality is dealt combat damage at the same time that a creature you control with lifelink deals combat damage), Angel of Vitality’s last ability applies before checking whether it’s destroyed for having lethal damage marked on it.
Because damage remains marked on a creature until it’s removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to Angel of Vitality may become lethal if your life total drops below 25 during that turn.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, life gained by your teammate won’t cause Angel of Vitality’s second ability to apply, even though it will cause your team’s life total to increase.
In multiplayer formats where your life total doesn’t start at 20, Angel of Vitality’s last ability still applies if your life total is 25 or more.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Angel of Vitality’s last ability applies as long as your team’s life total is 25 or more.

cards.name: Angelic Guardian
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, they gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

cards.name: Angelic Reward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has flying.

cards.name: Bond of Discipline
cards.text: Tap all creatures your opponents control. Creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn.

rulings.text: You can cast Bond of Discipline even if your opponents control no creatures or you control no creatures. The creatures that are on the battlefield will be affected as appropriate.

cards.name: Charmed Stray
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Charmed Stray enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each other creature you control named Charmed Stray.

cards.name: Confront the Assault
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if a creature is attacking you.
Create three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

cards.name: Fencing Ace
cards.text: Double strike

cards.name: Goring Ceratops
cards.text:
Double strike
Whenever Goring Ceratops attacks, other creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Hallowed Priest
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Hallowed Priest.

cards.name: Impassioned Orator
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Inspiring Commander
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life and draw a card.

cards.name: Knight's Pledge
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Leonin Warleader
cards.text: Whenever Leonin Warleader attacks, create two 1/1 white Cat creature tokens with lifelink that are tapped and attacking.

rulings.text: You choose which players or planeswalkers the two tokens are attacking. They don’t have to be attacking the same player or planeswalker that Leonin Warleader is attacking, and they can each be attacking different players and/or planeswalkers.
Although the tokens are attacking, they were never declared as attacking creatures (for the purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

cards.name: Moorland Inquisitor
cards.text: {2}{W}: Moorland Inquisitor gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

rulings.text: Multiple instances of first strike on the same creature are redundant.

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Soulmender
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spiritual Guardian
cards.text: When Spiritual Guardian enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Tactical Advantage
cards.text: Target blocking or blocked creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Cloudkin Seer
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudkin Seer enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Frilled Sea Serpent
cards.text: {5}{U}{U}: Frilled Sea Serpent can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: Once Frilled Sea Serpent has been blocked, activating its ability won’t change or undo that block.

cards.name: Glint
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +0/+3 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Octoprophet
cards.text: When Octoprophet enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Overflowing Insight
cards.text: Target player draws seven cards.

cards.name: Riddlemaster Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Riddlemaster Sphinx enters the battlefield, you may return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: River's Favor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Sleep
cards.text: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.

rulings.text: The second part of Sleep’s ability affects all creatures the targeted player controls as Sleep resolves, not only the ones that Sleep actually caused to become tapped.

cards.name: Soulblade Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Any spell you cast that doesn’t have the type creature will cause Soulblade Djinn’s ability to trigger. If a spell has multiple types, and one of those types is creature (such as an artifact creature), casting it won’t cause the ability to trigger. Playing a land also won’t cause it to trigger.
Soulblade Djinn’s ability goes on the stack on top of the spell that caused it to trigger. It will resolve before that spell.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Wall of Runes
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Wall of Runes enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Warden of Evos Isle
cards.text:
Flying
Creature spells with flying you cast cost {1} less to cast.

rulings.text: A creature spell that doesn’t have flying won’t cost less even if an effect will cause the creature to have flying once on the battlefield. This is also true if the creature spell itself has an ability that gives it flying once on the battlefield under certain conditions, even if those conditions are true.
The last ability of Warden of Evos Isle can’t reduce the colored mana requirement of a creature spell with flying.

cards.name: Waterkin Shaman
cards.text: Whenever a creature with flying enters the battlefield under your control, Waterkin Shaman gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Waterknot
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Waterknot enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Windreader Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature with flying attacks, you may draw a card.

rulings.text: It doesn’t matter who controls the creature with flying or which player or planeswalker that creature is attacking. Windreader Sphinx’s controller is the player who may draw a card.
Windreader Sphinx’s ability will trigger when it itself attacks.

The creature must have flying immediately after being declared as an attacking creature in order for Windreader Sphinx’s ability to trigger. For example, attacking with Kitesail Corsair will cause the ability to trigger, and attacking with Pegasus Courser and a creature without flying will cause the ability to trigger only once.

cards.name: Windstorm Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Other creatures you control with flying get +1/+0.

cards.name: Winged Words
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control a creature with flying.
Draw two cards.

rulings.text: Once you announce that you’re casting Winged Words, no player may take actions until the spell has been paid for. Notably, opponents can’t try to change whether you control a creature with flying.
Winged Words costs only {1} less to cast if you control multiple creatures with flying.

cards.name: Zephyr Gull
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Bad Deal
cards.text: You draw two cards and each opponent discards two cards. Each player loses 2 life.

rulings.text: You draw just two cards no matter how many opponents you have.
If an opponent has just one card in hand, that player discards just one card. Other opponents still discard two if able.
Each player loses 2 life, including you, regardless of how many cards they draw or discard.

As Bad Deal resolves, first you draw two cards. Then the next opponent in turn order (or, if it’s an opponent’s turn, the opponent whose turn it is) chooses two cards in hand without revealing them, then each other opponent in turn order does the same. All the chosen cards are discarded at the same time. Then each player loses 2 life.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Bad Deal causes each team to lose 4 life. Your teammate doesn’t draw or discard any cards.

cards.name: Compound Fracture
cards.text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. It gets an additional -1/-1 until end of turn for each card named Compound Fracture in your graveyard.

cards.name: Cruel Cut
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.

cards.name: Demon of Loathing
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever Demon of Loathing deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: If a creature is dealt lethal damage at the same time that Demon of Loathing deals combat damage to its controller, that player can’t sacrifice that creature.

cards.name: Eternal Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink and "Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature." (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

rulings.text: Multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

If the enchanted creature is dealt lethal damage at the same time as a creature an opponent controls, they’re destroyed at the same time. It won’t receive a +1/+1 counter from its ability in time to save it.

cards.name: Malakir Cullblade
cards.text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Malakir Cullblade.

cards.name: Mardu Outrider
cards.text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.

cards.name: Murder
cards.text: Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner’s graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare’s power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare’s power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare’s ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.name: Nimble Pilferer
cards.text: Flash

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.name: Sanitarium Skeleton
cards.text: {2}{B}: Return Sanitarium Skeleton from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Savage Gorger
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, if an opponent lost life this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Savage Gorger. (Damage causes loss of life.)

rulings.text: Savage Gorger looks at your entire turn to determine whether an opponent lost any life. It doesn’t matter how many opponents lost life or how much life they lost, only whether any of them did. It also doesn’t matter whether Savage Gorger was on the battlefield when they lost life.
It doesn’t matter whether an opponent has less life than they started the turn with. If a player lost 4 life but also gained 6 life, that player still lost 4 life.
A player loses life if they pay life.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.name: Skeleton Archer
cards.text: When Skeleton Archer enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Soulhunter Rakshasa
cards.text:
Soulhunter Rakshasa can't block.
When Soulhunter Rakshasa enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, it deals 1 damage to target opponent for each Swamp you control.

cards.name: Typhoid Rats
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Unlikely Aid
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

cards.name: Vampire Opportunist
cards.text: {6}{B}: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Vampire Opportunist’s ability causes the opposing team to lose 4 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Bombard
cards.text: Bombard deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Burn Bright
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Gang Leader
cards.text: When Goblin Gang Leader enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

cards.name: Goblin Gathering
cards.text: Create a number of 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens equal to two plus the number of cards named Goblin Gathering in your graveyard.

rulings.text: Goblin Gathering is still on the stack while you count the cards named Goblin Gathering in your graveyard. It doesn’t count itself.

cards.name: Goblin Trashmaster
cards.text:
Other Goblins you control get +1/+1.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it’s removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a Goblin you control may become lethal if Goblin Trashmaster leaves the battlefield during that turn.
You can sacrifice Goblin Trashmaster to pay the cost for its own ability.

cards.name: Goblin Tunneler
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: The power of the targeted creature is checked both as you target it and as the ability resolves. After the ability resolves, the creature can’t be blocked that turn even if its power becomes greater than 2.

The ability doesn’t grant an ability to the targeted creature. Rather, it affects the game rules and states something that’s now true about that creature. After the ability resolves, the creature can’t be blocked that turn even if it loses all abilities.

cards.name: Immortal Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Immortal Phoenix dies, return it to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If Immortal Phoenix leaves the graveyard after it dies but before its triggered ability resolves, it won’t be returned to its owner’s hand.

cards.name: Inescapable Blaze
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Inescapable Blaze deals 6 damage to any target.

cards.name: Maniacal Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.

cards.name: Molten Ravager
cards.text: {R}: Molten Ravager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nest Robber
cards.text: Haste

cards.name: Ogre Battledriver
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Raid Bombardment
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control with power 2 or less attacks, Raid Bombardment deals 1 damage to the player or planeswalker that creature is attacking.

rulings.text: The power of the attacking creature is checked only when the ability triggers. Once it triggers, Raid Bombardment will deal 1 damage to the appropriate player or planeswalker even if the creature’s power changes before the ability resolves.
If you attack with multiple creatures with power 2 or less, Raid Bombardment’s ability triggers for each of them separately.
A creature with 0 power can attack, as long as it doesn’t also have defender.

If the attacking creature leaves the battlefield before Raid Bombardment’s triggered ability resolves, Raid Bombardment deals 1 damage to the player or planeswalker that creature was attacking before it left the battlefield.

If a creature is attacking a planeswalker, and that planeswalker leaves the battlefield, that attacking creature can still be blocked. If it’s unblocked, the attacking creature is still attacking. It simply deals no combat damage.

cards.name: Reduce to Ashes
cards.text: Reduce to Ashes deals 5 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

rulings.text: The replacement effect of Reduce to Ashes will exile the target creature if it would die this turn for any reason, not just due to lethal damage.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.name: Siege Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Siege Dragon enters the battlefield, destroy all Walls your opponents control.
Whenever Siege Dragon attacks, if defending player controls no Walls, it deals 2 damage to each creature without flying that player controls.

cards.name: Storm Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Scry 1.

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Storm Strike tries to resolve, the spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t scry 1.

cards.name: Tin Street Cadet
cards.text: Whenever Tin Street Cadet becomes blocked, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text: Flying, haste

cards.name: Affectionate Indrik
cards.text: When Affectionate Indrik enters the battlefield, you may have it fight target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

rulings.text: You choose the target of the triggered ability as it goes on the stack, but you choose whether the creatures fight as that ability resolves.

If the target creature is an illegal target when Affectionate Indrik’s ability tries to resolve, the ability doesn’t resolve. If Affectionate Indrik is no longer on the battlefield, the target creature won’t deal or be dealt damage.

cards.name: Baloth Packhunter
cards.text:
Trample
When Baloth Packhunter enters the battlefield, put two +1/+1 counters on each other creature you control named Baloth Packhunter.

cards.name: Charging Badger
cards.text: Trample

cards.name: Colossal Majesty
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a creature with power 4 or greater, draw a card.

rulings.text: If you don't control a creature with power 4 or greater as your upkeep begins, Colossal Majesty's ability won't trigger. You can't take any actions during your turn before your upkeep begins.
If you don't control a creature with power 4 or greater as Colossal Majesty's ability resolves, you won't draw a card.

The creature with power 4 or greater that you control as Colossal Majesty's ability resolves doesn't have to be the same creature with power 4 or greater that was under your control as the ability triggered.
You draw only one card, no matter how many creatures with power 4 or greater you control.

cards.name: Epic Proportions
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +5/+5 and has trample.

cards.name: Feral Roar
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Generous Stray
cards.text: When Generous Stray enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Greenwood Sentinel
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Ilysian Caryatid
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, add two mana of any one color instead.

rulings.text: Ilysian Caryatid’s activated ability is a mana ability. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to.

cards.name: Jungle Delver
cards.text: {3}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Jungle Delver.

cards.name: Prized Unicorn
cards.text: All creatures able to block Prized Unicorn do so.

rulings.text: If a creature the defending player controls can’t block Prized Unicorn for any reason (such as being tapped), then it doesn’t block Prized Unicorn. If there’s a cost associated with having a creature block Prized Unicorn, the defending player isn’t forced to pay that cost, so it doesn’t have to block.
If more than one Prized Unicorn is attacking, creatures that could block must block one Prized Unicorn, but they don’t all have to block the same Prized Unicorn.

cards.name: Rabid Bite
cards.text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

rulings.text: If either creature is an illegal target as Rabid Bite tries to resolve, the creature you control won’t deal damage.

cards.name: Rampaging Brontodon
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Rampaging Brontodon attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each land you control.

cards.name: Sentinel Spider
cards.text: Vigilance, reach

cards.name: Stony Strength
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Untap that creature.

rulings.text: Stony Strength can target any creature you control, even one that’s already untapped.

cards.name: Titanic Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wildwood Patrol
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

cards.name: Woodland Mystic
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.

cards.name: World Shaper
cards.text:
Whenever World Shaper attacks, you may mill three cards.
When World Shaper dies, return all land cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Arcane Signet
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.

rulings.text: If you have two commanders, the ability adds one mana of any color in their combined color identities.
If your commander is a card that has no colors in its color identity, Arcane Signet's ability produces no mana. It doesn't produce {C}.
If you don't have a commander, Arcane Signet's ability produces no mana.

cards.name: Command Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color in your commander's color identity.

rulings.text: If you have two commanders, the ability adds one mana of any color in their combined color identities.
If your commander is a card that has no colors in its color identity, Command Tower's ability produces no mana. It doesn't produce {C}.
If you don't have a commander, Command Tower's ability produces no mana.
